channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Manufacturers shrink for 9th month in a row, ISM finds. Tariffs hurt sales and keep lid on hiring.
item.description: A closely followed manufacturing index fell to a four-month low, with executives saying business isn’t getting any better.

item.title: Here’s what might turn the tide for value stocks and the broader market over growth stocks in 2026

item.title: Synopsys gets an Nvidia boost. Here’s what to know.
item.description: Nvidia has made a $2 billion investment in Synopsys and has a new partnership with the maker of chip-design software.

item.title: My brother has fallen on hard times. My sister wants to buy his house. Is that a good idea?
item.description: “She will let him live in it free of charge and continue to take care of the maintenance.”

item.title: My sons will each inherit $500K laundromats from their grandparents. How do we keep their spouses out of it?
item.description: “The businesses each have two employees who manage the day-to-day operations.”

item.title: Guggenheim sees more gains ahead for Alphabet due to growing Cloud demand, top AI platform
item.description: Guggenheim believes that Alphabet has room to run higher.

item.title: Shopify has been on a tear in 2025. Can AI give the e-commerce stock another boost?
item.description: Shopify is up about 50% year to date and reached an all-time high in October.

item.title: Here are Monday's biggest analyst calls: Nvidia, Apple, Tesla, Broadcom, Wynn, Chevron, Amazon & more
item.description: Here are Monday's biggest calls on Wall Street.

item.title: Morgan Stanley hikes price targets for two chipmakers, sees Nvidia rising more than 40%
item.description: Morgan Stanley cited AI strength as a tailwind for both Nvidia and Broadcom.

item.title: This stock tied to U.S. housing could be in trouble. How to make money on potential declines through options
item.description: Michael Khouw explains why selling calls on this name makes sense.
